snippet: Overseas groups and the Tibetan government in exile described tension in an area that has been plagued by strife over the Chinese government’s rule.
abstract: Tibetan government and other groups abroad say five Tibetans have died in police custody in southwestern China following protest during which residents where shot and wounded; accounts point to rising tensions in mountainous Sichuan Province region, which has long been in turmoil under China's rule.

byline.contributor: Kiki Zhao contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Overseas groups and the Tibetan government in exile described tension in an area that has been plagued by strife over the Chinese government’s rule.

headline.main: 5 Tibetans Are Said to Die In Chinese Police Custody
headline.print_headline: 5 Tibetans Are Said to Die in Chinese Police Custody
